title: About Me
content: Ifeoluwa Osinuga is a final-year Computer Science student who enjoys building responsive, user-friendly applications using Next.js, React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. She is fascinated by how technology solves real-world problems and enjoys exploring new tools that push her creativity further. Outside of coding, she loves scrolling through social media or watching Kdramas.

title: Skills
content: React.js, Next.js, JavaScript, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, HTML, CSS, Git, GitHub, Figma, AWS basics including EC2, Amplify, Cognito, VPC, S3, PostgreSQL, Terraform.

title: Education
content: Studying BSc Computer Science at Lagos State University with modules Software Engineering, Web and Internet Technology, Basic Java, basic C++, Algorithms and Data Structures, Systems Design and Security, Data Driven Computing, Databases, Computer Architecture and Networking. Expected graduation September 2026. Completed Frontend Engineering program at AltSchool Africa with modules including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Next.js, and accessibility.

title: My Tech Journey
content: I started my tech journey fresh out of highschool out of curiosity and a desire to understand how the apps and websites I used every day were built. This led me to apply to study Computer science in the University. During my university years I am building on improving my tech skills, I enrolled in the Frontend Engineering program at AltSchool Africa, where I improved my Frontend skills. As I built more projects, I fell in love with creating interfaces that feel intuitive, responsive, and visually appealing. During my third year of uni, in my second semester, I went for my SIWES(IT) which lasted a period of six months. During my IT period I explored other tech fields and my interest expanded into UI/UX design, cloud engineering and automation, which led me to explore AWS, Terraform, AI/ML and backend concepts during my SIWES internship. Today, I enjoy combining strong frontend skills with backend knowledge to build scalable, real-world applications.

title: Personal Portfolio Website
content: A fully responsive personal portfolio website designed to showcase my projects, experience, and skills. It features smooth animations, reusable components, a clean UI, and optimized routing. Built with modern frontend tools and deployed on Vercel. Serves as the central hub for my online presence.

title: Interneefy – Internship Management System
content: Interneefy is a full-stack internship management system built as my SIWES project. It streamlines the internship lifecycle for organizations, offering dashboards for admins, supervisors, and interns. Users can register, assign and track tasks, submit reports, and monitor performance. Designed with scalability, clarity, and real-world usability in mind. Ifeoluwa's most notable project.

title: Tic Tac Toe Game
content: A simple and interactive implementation of the classic Tic-Tac-Toe game. Built as part of The Odin Project curriculum, focusing on DOM manipulation, game logic, modular JavaScript patterns, and responsive layout.

title: Advanced Todo Application
content: A feature-rich todo application with CRUD operations, pagination, dynamic routing, and database persistence. Built with a focus on clean structure, component reuse, and modern React patterns.

title: Etch A Sketch
content: A web-based drawing playground inspired by the classic Etch A Sketch toy. Built as part of The Odin Project curriculum, users can draw on a grid, choose different sizes, and reset the canvas. Built to practice DOM manipulation and event handling.

title: Space Tourism Website
content: A responsive multipage space-themed website built from a Frontend Mentor challenge. Includes navigation between destinations, crew members, and technology pages. Demonstrates advanced layout skills and clean UI design.

title: Loan Dashboard
content: A static loan dashboard application that allows users to visualize loan metrics and repayment data. Includes charts, responsive layout, and clean design. Created to practice frontend dashboard UI and chart integrations.

title: Positivus Landing Page
content: A modern landing page for Positivus, showcasing their services and offerings. Designed with a clean layout, smooth flow, and responsive design. Focuses on frontend layout mastery and aesthetics.

title: E-commerce Product Page
content: A responsive e-commerce product detail page created from a Frontend Mentor challenge. Includes product gallery, add-to-cart functionality, and clean responsive UI. Built to strengthen TypeScript and component-based design.

title: Career Goals
content: Aiming to become a strong software engineer with fullstack capabilities, with interests in AI/ML, accessible user interfaces, and building scalable applications.

experience.description: During my Student Industrial Work Experience Scheme (SIWES), I interned at Cecure Intelligence Limited under the Engineering Department. I rotated through four main domains: frontend engineering, design engineering, cloud engineering, and machine learning/AI. Under the guidance of senior engineers, I gained hands-on experience building secure, scalable, and user-friendly digital solutions.
highlights: Worked across frontend, design, cloud, and ML/AI engineering
Collaborated with mentors and senior engineers
Strengthened skills in React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Figma
Gained exposure to Terraform and AWS services
Contributed to documentation and engineering best practices

title: Personality & Work Values
content: Ifeoluwa values clean design, reliability, attention to detail, and consistent improvement. She enjoys taking feedback, learning quickly, and asking the right questions. Her work style is organized, curious, and focused—she prefers understanding concepts deeply rather than rushing. She loves building things that are both aesthetically pleasing and technically sound.

title: Fun Facts
content: She loves Kdramas, enjoys scrolling through social media in her free time, and likes exploring new tech tools. She is one of the 20 winners of upskill 3.0(2025) with Cardtonic.

title: Contact & Socials
content: You can reach me through my portfolio or social platforms. I am open to collaborations, voluntary and paid opportunities, and frontend-focused roles. Feel free to explore more of my work or connect with me online.
